reviewText: The instructor was very difficult to listen to, seemed to have dry mouth in every video. I feel that he shared more conversation than instruction. In the case studies, we were asked for our opinions, but the multiple choice answers were catering to his opinions. This made it very hard to answer the questions correctly. You can't ask what I think or what I found, then ask me to answer questions based on my findings, but score me based on your own. I disagreed with the instructor on many issues but had to give contradictory answers to multiple choice answers just for them to be marked correct. There was also a lot of repetitive information given. I don't think there's a need for this course after taking John C Kellog's course "Music Business Foundations". I think Mr. Kellog covered everything in this course and was much more interesting and clear in his explanations. This course is more opinions than facts.
The course touches on interesting topics but never goes in depth enough to be satisfying.
If you dot know how to analyze music, (tempo, melody, ect) you will have a hard time with the case studies and quizes.
Basic Informations, often confusing explanations of concepts

An accessible course for those who do not have much experience with law but have a general understanding of music and musical analysis (chord progressions, roman numeral analysis, basic tempo and form).

The course provides a very elementary introduction to copyright law.  No external reading is required.  I would recommend reading "Music Copyright Law" by David Moser.  This book provides a more in-depth approach to dealing with the actual copyright code.

Para la especializacion que estoy haciendo, creo que es bastante similar al primer curso que tome (Music business foundations), hubiera sido interesante, adema¬¥s de reforzar el conocimiento de ese primer curso, haber aprendido algunas otras cosas.
Law is not that much involved in the course
The instructor is extremely knowledgeable and breaks copyright law down in digestible pieces. Every musician and songwriter should take this course.
Nice course to have a good idea of the law in the copyright world.

Thank you
It was a great course, it has a los of examples and give you a base to understand and go beyond that.

Everything in this course was explained well. I feel like if you want to learn about copyright among other things, such as record contracts, then go for Music Business Basics with Jon Kellogg. This course, for me, offered a way to reconsolidate my learning for this course rather than an introduction to a load more ideas, bar there was a good amount of case studies and talk about the process of going to court. Overall a good course. P.S. I took this within the Music Business specialisation, which included Music Business Foundations as a course.
For what it covered the course was great.  It should have covered much more sheet music.
Great course to understand basics.
Amazing
It was great for beginner to learn about copyright in music industry.
very easy to understand, really enjoyed the course and the vitations as well.
Very informative with real life cases in the music business as example. thank you!
very clear well done course
A little bit "stream of consciousness" in delivery, but the content is useful and the quizzes were challenging and thought provoking.

Absolutely loved the structure and setup of the course Copyright Law in the Music Business. You will really find it a worth wild, fast, smooth, and instant learn in finding out how record companies, record labels, lawyers, judges, and the most important general topic overall in the natural field of Entertainment. Those who are wanting to learn more or who aren musically inclined (by the slightest) and have the interest in learning Entertainment law, Copyright, a small ounce of Music Theory, and Music Business. Then, this is a safe and sound course for you to enroll in! Definitely, go ahead and take advantage of going LIVE with your fellow classmates. Also, just because this course doesn't have "Discussion Boards" pinned, doesn't mean it's completely exiled. Please take proper notes in this online course. Believe and trust me, you'll find the course a lot more enjoyable and worth every single moment of time if you jot down every single thought and notate every single bit of information (pertaining to the essentiality and significance of the core of Music Business and Copyright Law).
I really needed this course. Thank you. The Instructor is a well informed person!
Very insightful
Copyright Law internationally is a very broad subject. How one profits and protects one's own creation is  another thing that is something that makes a huge the difference in the music industry.
It was really engaging and an eye opener for me personally
Great course! Really helpful!

I really liked and enjoyed this course. I think Mr Harringtonis a great teacher. He has a lot of experience and has a very  nice way of explaining the lessons.  There are many many things i didn¬¥t know and i am really glad that i now have this knowledge and can apply it in the future. I enjoyed the practical cases of study and going more in depth with song analysis to give an opinion in cases of copyright infringement. I thought it would be boring but not at all. The lessons are clear and concise.

I am very happy with all the knowledge that I gained since I enrolled on Coursera. Mr. Michael Harrington, the professor, explained the COPYRIGHT LAW in the Music Business in the simplest words and I also picked up a lot of technical topics which helped gain more knowledge in this field. With basic knowledge about the music industry, this course helped me even more and I will keep on exploring other related topics. Everything is amazing! Bravo!

"E. Michael Harrington's presentation of Copyright Law in the Music Business is 'above the Bar' ...thorough, 'understandable' and 'upbeat.'  It was a great experience learning from his videos; there were 'real world' examples of 'Copyright Cases' intertwined with 'Federal Law' and 'Court Structure' lessons, truly educational... a great combination!" - Evan McNeeley

Interesting case studies. The teacher was very amicable.
I learned things I never knew happened in the music departments. This class was an eye opener.
An amazing journey. It is very surprising how taking this course has changed my world view of the music industry.

An amazing course with an amazing professor. The Copyright Law in the Music Business allows us to know more about the laws behind our everyday practice, that are playing music and composing songs, and allow us to be aware of future issues that we don't want to face and if they happend, how to solve this problems.

I'm really grateful that there are such a great resource available online from Berklee. I'm massively missing a lesson about Public Domain - how you can find out for sure if something is already in public domain and how you are supposed to submit your music to publishers and PROs when your music includes Public Domain contents.A general feedback to all Berklee Music training courses: the networking opportunity through howdy learning is a great idea but without moderation or some kind of lead these meetings aren't as useful as they could be.
It's a perfect course, it allowed me to know the fundamental areas of law in the music industry, so now I can go deeper and deeper, depending on the things I need to know about.

It was a very complete course to understand the principles of copyright and copyright law. I think it is a good start for musicians that want to know how copyright works and even for lawyers to get to know more about composition and sound and how it is important to keep the in mind when having a case involving copyright law infringement.
Brilliant

E. Michael is a great lecturer, taking each topic one at a time and explaining each of them clearly and in a detailed manner. He is very easy to understand and makes learning enjoyable. Thank you for the opportunity to grow my knowledge on this matter.

In my opinion, this course takes you through a journey of copyright law in the music industry. I got to learn a lot of new things and had an amazing experience during the lectures and in solving relevant questions to check my understanding of the topic. I would recommend this course to people who love music and who are interested in understanding the copyright law that governs music.

thank you for walking us through the intricacies of copyright. I was really moved to learn how many elements are required to evaluate when verifying infringement. Music has always been a multi-dimensional experience for me, but now, I feel as though it has been opened up even more!

To all law/non-law students who have a massive interest in Intellectual Property and Music, you will not regret paying for this interesting and exciting course! Overall, I feel superbly satisfied with this course :)
The way in which this course is taught is really easy to understand and fun. I would surely recommend doing it!
Enjoyed every bit of it!
